Introduction

What is Dinoloop?

Dinoloop is a REST API library for building scalable Node.js server-side applications powered by TypeScript. Dinoloop uses Expressjs and has been designed with a simple motto - to reuse similar design patterns of C#/JAVA/OOP minded programmers (OOP practices, SOLID principles and MVC architecture) in Node.js. Dinoloop adds syntactic sugar to Expressjs empowering OOP programmers to easily switch to Node.js without the steep learning curve.

TypeScript?

We love TypeScript because it provides great tooling to build enterprise applications. Angular uses TypeScript and now every npm package has types. If you love Angular (like us), we highly advise you to use Dinoloop to maintain a single TypeScript codebase for your MEAN application.

Why Dinoloop?

As a contributor, we welcome you to give it a try (for your personal or small sized projects and see how it scales). In the same way Expressjs does not abstract you from Node.js, Dinoloop does not abstract you from Expressjs (you have complete access to Node.js and Expressjs). You are free to use/mix the Node.js and Expressjs API in your development. Dinoloop is a library more than a framework (like ReactJS, we love what ReactJS does client-side). You can develop an entire application in Dinoloop, part of an application, or gradually migrate an existing Expressjs application to Dinoloop. The first principle of Dinoloop is to provide an architecture to developers and not to create a complete bundled framework. We love and support pluggable architecture.

Features

  • Super easy set-up. The Dinoloop team provides a recommended starter project so you can start building right away. We want our developers to have the freedom to choose DI or not. You can develop APIs without using DI framework.
    1. Without DI framework dinoloop-starter-without-DI
    2. With DI framework dinoloop-starter-with-DI (uses Inversifyjs)
  • Supports Expressjs middlewares with a completely Expressjs driven library. Here is one example that uses Expressjs middleware in Dinoloop.
  • Heavily influenced by MVC pattern.
  • Configurable Dependency Injection framework. You can choose your favorite DI framework InversifyJs, peppermint-di and more or build one of your own.
  • Proper isolation of controllers and services for better unit-testing. You can use moq.ts (plain with less code) to create mocks inside unit tests.
  • Controller middlewares - ActionFilters, ExceptionFilters, ResultFilters with Robust sync/async (handles es6 async/await pattern).
  • Application middlewares - RequestStart, RequestEnd and ServerError with Robust sync/async (handles es6 async/await pattern).
  • UserIdentity principal across requests. Still an experimental feature.

Philosophy

Dinoloop lets users freely upgrade/downgrade Expressjs. Installing Dinoloop won't install Express. You can install your own version of Express. All you have to provide is the Express app and router instances to Dinoloop.

Why Expressjs is not bundled as dependency?

Dinoloop is an Expressjs library with the core principles centered around being a light-weight and pluggable architecture. We use the same principles of libraries to work with targeted versions. Dinoloop version 1.x.x works with Expressjs >= 4.x.x version.

Principles

Dinoloop has been designed from the start to support gradual adoption so you can use as little or as much Dinoloop as you need. Perhaps you only want to develop some REST APIs using Dinoloop and others with Expressjs. In this section, we show how to create a Dinoloop REST API with an existing or newly created Express app.

Motivation

TypeScript (a superset of Javascript) supports object oriented programming (which pairs great with SOLID design principles). Dinoloop has simple motto - to apply SOLID principles and reuse Java and C# design patterns in Node.js. We are not trying to make every Node.js developer an OOP programmer, we would just like to provide an OOP architecture framework. We love JavaScript the way it is.
